Description: Green glazed composition (worn) wadj papyrus-column amulet, with a suspension ring at the top (broken away); capital and lower part decorated with incisions before firing.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound ? (?)
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, if not from Tell Nabasha or any other Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886. If from Tell Dafana, possibly one of the 5 "papyrus sceptres" among the "glazed pottery amulets of late work, probably late Ptolemaic", from the North-west mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.60, p.180, pl.22)
Condition: incomplete - suspension ring lost; capital re-affixed to the shaft.
